summary.para: The CountModes method retrieves the number of display modes that the Full Screen Renderer supports.

param.name: pModes
param.para: Pointer to the returned mode count.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The GetAcceleratorTable method retrieves the accelerator table currently being used to translate keyboard messages. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method.

param.name: phwnd
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a window handle. The window receives translated messages.

param.name: phAccel
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives a handle to the accelerator table.

summary.para: The GetCaption method retrieves the caption associated with the full-screen window.

param.name: pstrCaption
param.para: Pointer to a BSTR that receives the caption.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: The caption is visible when the window is minimized.
The caller must release the returned string, by calling the SysFreeString function.

summary.para: The GetClipFactor method retrieves the clip factor, which determines how much of the video the Full Screen Renderer is allowed to clip. For example, if the clip factor is 25, the Full Screen Renderer can clip up to 25% of the video.

param.name: pClipFactor
param.para: Pointer to a variable the receives the clip factor.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The GetCurrentMode method retrieves the current display mode.

param.name: pMode
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the current video mode. Pass this index to the method to obtain information about this mode, including the width, height, and bit depth.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The filter did not load DirectDraw.

summary.para: The GetMessageDrain method retrieves the window that receives mouse and keyboard messages, if any.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the handle of the window. If no window has been designated to receive messages, this parameter receives the value NULL.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to the method.
The Full Screen video renderer posts all mouse and keyboard messages to the window designated as a message drain. The exact list of messages that are posted is the same as the list given in .
Applications do not need to use this method. Use the method on the Filter Graph Manager instead.

summary.para: The GetModeInfo method retrieves information about a specified display mode supported by the Full Screen Renderer filter.

param.name: Mode
param.para: Index of the display mode.

param.name: pWidth
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the width of the display mode, in pixels.

param.name: pHeight
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the height of the display mode, in pixels.

param.name: pDepth
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the bit depth of the display mode.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The specified display mode is not available and is disabled.

remarks.para: Display modes are indexed from zero. The method returns the number of modes.

summary.para: The GetMonitor method queries which monitor the Full Screen Renderer is using. The Full Screen Renderer only supports the primary monitor, so the returned value is always zero.

param.name: Monitor
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of the monitor.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The HideOnDeactivate method . Depending on the setting, the full-screen video window is either minimized or hidden. If it is minimized, it appears as an icon in the task bar; otherwise, it does not.

param.name: Hide
param.para: Value that specifies the behavior when the application is deactivated. Set to OATRUE to hide the icon; set to OAFALSE to display the icon.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The IsHideOnDeactivate method indicates the behavior when the user switches to another application. Depending on the setting, the full-screen video window is either minimized or hidden. If it is minimized, it appears as an icon in the task bar; otherwise, it does not.

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

summary.para: The IsKeepPixelAspectRatio method queries whether the pixel aspect ratio is maintained. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method; it always maintains the pixel aspect ratio.

param.name: pKeepAspect
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the value OATRUE or OAFALSE.

summary.para: The IsModeAvailable method queries whether a specified display mode is available.

param.name: Mode
param.para: Index of the display mode.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

description.para: The display mode is not available.

remarks.para: The Full Screen Renderer supports a static set of display modes. However, the video card on the user's system might not support every mode. If a particular display mode is not supported by the video card, this method returns S_FALSE. Even if a particular mode is available, it will not necessarily be used for video playback. The mode must also be compatible with the filters in the filter graph.
You can disable a display mode by calling the method. The Full Screen Renderer will not use a disabled mode, even if the video card supports it.
Display modes are indexed from zero. The method returns the number of modes.

summary.para: The IsModeEnabled method queries whether a specified display mode is enabled.

param.name: Mode
param.para: Index of the display mode to query.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: The Full Screen Renderer supports a static set of display modes. By default, every mode is enabled. You can enable or disable a display mode by calling the . The IsEnabled method retrieves the current setting for the specified mode.

The video card on the user's system might not support every mode. The Full Screen Renderer will not use a mode that the video card does not support, even if that mode is enabled. To determine whether the card supports a particular mode, call the method. If a mode is disabled, the Full Screen Renderer will not use it, even if the card supports it.
Display modes are indexed from zero. The method returns the number of modes.

summary.para: The KeepPixelAspectRatio method specifies whether to maintain the pixel aspect ratio. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method; it always maintains the pixel aspect ratio.

param.name: KeepAspect
param.para: Specifies whether to maintain the aspect ratio. The value must be OATRUE or OAFALSE.

summary.para: The SetAcceleratorTable method specifies an accelerator table that will be used to translate keyboard messages. The Full Screen Renderer filter does not support this method.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Handle of the window that will receive the translated messages.

param.name: hAccel
param.para: Handle to the accelerator table.

summary.para: The SetCaption method sets the caption associated with the full-screen window.

param.name: strCaption
param.para: String containing the caption.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: The caption is visible when the window is minimized.

summary.para: The SetClipFactor method specifies the clip factor, which determines how much of the video the Full Screen Renderer is allowed to clip.

For example, suppose the display mode is 320 x 200 and the video is 352 x 288 pixels. Assuming the decoder cannot shrink the video, the display will clip about 25 percent of the image. The clip factor specifies the upper range that is permitted. The default value is 25%.

param.name: ClipFactor
param.para: Specifies the maximum allowable amount of the image to clip. The value is expressed as a percentage from 0 to 100.

summary.para: The SetDefault method saves the current settings.

remarks.para: Normally, the properties set through this interface apply only to the current instance of the Full Screen Renderer. Calling this method saves the current values as the global default. This method persists the following information:

item.description: The enabled flag for each display mode.

remarks.para: It does not persist the caption or the hide-when-deactivated flag.

summary.para: The SetEnabled method enables or disables a specified display mode.

param.name: Mode
param.para: Index of the display mode to enable or disable.

param.name: bEnabled
param.para: Specifies one of the following Boolean values:

remarks.para: The Full Screen Renderer supports a static set of display modes. By default, every mode is enabled. You can use this method to enable or disable a particular display mode. The video card on the user's system might not support every mode. The Full Screen Renderer will not use a mode that the video card does not support, even if that mode is enabled. To determine whether the card supports a particular mode, call the method. If a mode is disabled, the Full Screen Renderer will not use it, even if the card supports it.
Display modes are indexed from zero. The method returns the number of modes. To retrieve the width, height, and bit depth of a particular display mode, call the method.

summary.para: The SetMessageDrain method specifies a window to receive mouse and keyboard messages from the video window.

param.name: hwnd
param.para: Specifies a handle to the message-drain window.

remarks.para: This method is equivalent to the method.

The Full Screen video renderer posts all mouse and keyboard messages to the window designated as a message drain. The exact list of messages that are posted is the same as the list given in put_MessageDrain.

Applications do not need to use this method. Instead, call the Filter Graph Manager's put_MessageDrain method before switching to full-screen mode. The Filter Graph Manager automatically sets the same message drain on the renderer that it selects for full-screen mode.

summary.para: The SetMonitor method specifies which monitor to use. The Full Screen Renderer only supports the primary monitor, however, so this method is not useful in the current implementation.

param.name: Monitor
param.para: Specifies the index of the monitor to use. Must be zero in the current implementation.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The IFullScreenVideoEx interface is implemented on the Full Screen Renderer filter, which provides full-screen video rendering on older hardware. Newer video cards can stretch the video efficiently enough that the Full Screen Renderer is not required. Therefore, both the filter and this interface are now deprecated.
